original_title: Orange FM Brings Radio to the GameBoy
original_content:
Weve all been there. You left your Walkman at home and only have your trusty Game Boy. You want to take a break and just listen to some tunes. What to do? [orangeglo] has the answer now with the Orange FM cartridge.
This prototype cart features an onboard antenna or can also use the 3.5 mm headphone/antenna port on the cartridge to boost reception with either a dedicated antenna or a set of headphones. Frequencies supported are 64  108 Mhz, and spacing can be set for 100 or 200 kHz to accomodate most FM broadcasts setups around the world.
Older Game Boys can support audio through the device itself, but Advances will need to use the audio port on the cartridge. The Super Game Boy can pipe audio to your TV though, which seems like a delightfully Rube Goldberg-ian way to listen to the radio. Did we mention it also supports RDS, so youll know what that catchy tune is? Try that FM Walkman!
Cant decide between this and your other carts? Try this revolving multi-cart solution. Have a Game Boy that needs some restoration? If its due to electrolyte damage, maybe start here?
title: Orange FMカートリッジ：Game BoyでFMラジオを楽しもう！
body: Game Boyでラジオを楽しむ方法を提供するOrange FMカートリッジが紹介されている。64〜108MHzの周波数に対応し、ラジオ放送を楽しめる。オーディオポートを使用してラジオを聞くことも可能。修理が必要なGame Boyにも対応。
titles: Orange FMカートリッジ：Game BoyでFMラジオを楽しもう！
ゲームボーイ用オレンジFMカートリッジ：FMラジオ受信をサポート
ワイドな周波数対応：オレンジFMカートリッジを使ってラジオを楽しむ
ゲームボーイの進化をサポート：オレンジFMカートリッジの活用法
復元やメンテナンスにも最適：オレンジFMカートリッジを活用したゲームボーイの修理
